meanings.definition: filled with too many people or things
meanings.sent1: The classroom felt overcrowded with students sitting shoulder to shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The train was overcrowded with passengers during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The tiny elevator felt overcrowded when the clown car pulled up.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were like an overcrowded ant hill during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The small boat became dangerously overcrowded with all the extra passengers.

meanings.definition: having too many occupants for the available space
meanings.sent1: The apartment building was overcrowded with families sharing small units.
meanings.sent2: The bus was overcrowded, and people had to stand in the aisles.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket looked overcrowded with all the food and drinks spread out.
meanings.sent4: The parking lot was so overcrowded, finding a spot was like a game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent5: The elevator became overcrowded, and the doors struggled to close properly.
